website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you want well-made tools for jobs that require Torx 6-point star pattern.
pros: Rugged, German-manufactured construction with Torx tips
Mechanics love the contoured handles and wall-mount organizing rack
cons: Somewhat costly considering you only get six pieces, and they are not as versatile as screwdrivers in some other sets

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the DIY'er
customer_reviews.text: When do you need a T20, or a star head, Torx wrench? Probably when you can't find the stupid thing for the last, critical part of your removal project and now you're SOL. Don't be that guy, fumbling with some pocket tool torx set. This is a great set that has most of the common sizes for various applications. I've used the heck out of mine so far for driving deck screws in to perfect flushness, removing air intake housing on a Jeep, and more. Really good feel and sturdy material that hasn't stripped out on me yet.

Size:TX10x80mm, TX15x80mm, TX20x100mm, TX25x100mm, TX30x115mm, TX40x140mmWera Kraftform 6 Piece TORX Screwdriver set is designed for the Professional user. All Wera hand tools feature the trademarked ergonomic Kraftform handle, with hard and soft zones, that fits the shape to the hand for the ultimate in comfort and high-speed torque transfer. Handle marking on top of handle includes screw symbol and size of tip to easily find the right screwdriver in your toolbox or workplace. Anti-roll protection at base of handle stops screwdriver from rolling away at workplace. Limited Life Time Warranty. Set contains 6 TORX Screwdrivers - TX10, TX15, TX20, TX25, TX30, TX40. Includes wall-mounting rack for convenient storage and tool retrieval. Wera – The Best Tools For The Job!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


367/6 SCREWDRIVER SET KRAFTFORM PLUS TORX® AND RACK
Kraftform Plus screwdrivers enable a higher transfer of force with less effort and relieve the entire hand-arm system – even with intensive use. Combined with other technical and practical product advantages such as the Lasertip for a secure fit in the screw head, Kraftform screwdrivers are the ideal choice for manual screwdriving jobs.

The basic idea for the prototype of the Kraftform handle – that the hand should dictate the design – has, right through to today, proved to be correct. In cooperation with the internationally recognised Fraunhofer- Institut, Wera developed a screwdriver handle designed to match the shape of the human hand as long ago as the 1960s. After a long development phase, the Wera Kraftform handle was launched to the market in 1968. It has been optimized through the years with new technologies, but has kept its proven shape. After all, the human hand has not changed either.


The outstanding design of the Kraftform handle fits perfectly into the hand to help prevent hand injuries such as blisters and calluses. The large contact area – with particularly high friction to the soft zones – results in high torque transfer without any bruising from the edges. The Kraftform handle functions superbly in all application situations, even when the environment often does not allow any direct tool access.

Wera makes its Kraftform handles from several materials with different properties. The core is made from a hardwearing plastic that holds the blade securely even when subjected to great forces. The colour-coded soft zones of the external mantle consist of a softer material with more friction resistance for high torque transfer. The black areas with a harder surface prevent the hand from sticking to the handle enabling you to adjust your grip more quickly.

THE KEY BENEFITS:
 * Kraftform handle fits perfectly into the hand
 * Screw symbol and tip size identification markings on the handle
 * Hexagonal non-roll feature prevents any rolling away
 * Screwdriver set is supplied with a wall-mountable rack
 * Limited lifetime warranty
 * German engineered

The hexagonal non-roll feature prevents any rolling in the workplace.

The screwdriver sets are always supplied with a wall-mountable rack. This ensures organised storage and quick access. The rack is also available as an individual item. Screws are not included.

The screw symbol and tip size identification markings on the handle make it easier to find the right screwdriver in the tool case or at the workplace.

WHY IS THE KRAFTFORM PLUS HANDLE MADE FROM SEVERAL COMPONENTS?
Wera makes its Kraftform handles from several materials with different properties. The core is made from a hardwearing plastic that holds the blade securely even when subjected to great force. The colour-coded soft zones of the external mantle consist of a softer material with more friction resistance for high torque transfer. The black areas with a harder surface prevent the hand from sticking to the handle, enabling quick grip adjustment.

Wera is one of the world's leading manufacturers of screw driving tools under the Wera, Kraftform, and Zyklop brands. The company was founded in 1941 and is headquartered in Wuppertal, Germany. Wera develops and produces tools for professional and industrial applications, and is a solution provider for problems associated with screw connections. Quality is assured through a manufacturing process that is continually monitored. Wera is International Standard Organization (ISO) certified. Wera has received several awards for the stylish and ergonomic design of its products.
